newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sega up,Bandai ask-only after merger cancellation.
newsitem.headline: Sega up,Bandai ask-only after merger cancellation.

text.p: Sega Enterprises Ltd shares rose and Bandai Co Ltd was ask-only in early Wednesday morning trade after the two firms announced late Tuesday that they had called off their plans to merge.
As of 0010 GMT, Sega, known for its Sega Saturn 32-bit videogame player, was up 100 yen at 3,800, while toymaker Bandai was ask-only at 2,720.

Bandai said late on Tuesday it had called off the merger with Sega because it lacked synergy and that the two companies would instead pursue a business tie-up covering character entertainment and retailing, consumer products, manufacturing and distribution.

Speculation had already been rife prior to the announcement that the merger could be delayed due to strong opposition from mid-level managers at Bandai, a closely knit toymaker heartened by its recent runaway hit with the Tamagotchi virtual pet toy.
"In the process leading up to the merger annullment, there were media reports of turmoil within Bandai, which is not appreciated by the market," one fund manager said.
